result.execSummary:
The defendant Clemente Lamont Alexander Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample. Defendant to pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 4/17/15, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Cash bail to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Defendant may request an extension if making payments, and court will grant.

TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clemente Lamont Alexander Sr

defendant.name: Alexander, Clemente Lamont, Sr
defendant.address: 6705 West Silver Spring Drive, Milwaukee, WI 53218

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay.  10 days HOC,  consecutive.  Due & owing.

Defendant Clemente Lamont Alexander in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 53 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 53 days time served.  

TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 4/17/2015, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Cash bail to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Defendant may request an extension if making payments, and court will grant.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw
Attorney Scholle would like case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 4/17/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw

Attorney Mary D. Scholle in court, defendant Clemente Lamont Alexander not in court, in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel needs to go over discovery and offer with her client.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 4/16/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
14RM015295  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 3/14/14

Defendant Clemente Lamont Alexander in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Defendant Clemente Lamont Alexander in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #06CF6451 that are attached to the complaint.  Defense Counsel requests sequestration of withnesses.  Sworn for the state:Dwain Monteilh-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Clemente Lamont Alexander in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Defendant Clemente Lamont Alexander in custody.  Paul Hauer for Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case was originally calendared for the morning, but due to the time of day and the court's calendar the case was called on the record in the afternoon. Defendant is requesting a hearing, officer was present this morning, but unavailable for the afternoon.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Clemente Lamont Alexander in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Defendant Clemente Lamont Alexander in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
